text: Ishfaq Ahmad (3 November 1930 â€“ 18 January, 2018) D.Sc., Minister of State, SI, HI, NI, FPAS, was a Pakistani nuclear physicist, emeritus professor of high-energy physics at the National Center for Physics, and former science advisor to the Government of Pakistan. ==Death== Ahmad died on 18 January 2018 in Islamabad at the age of 87.Nuclear physicist Ishfaq Ahmad passes away at 87 ==Honors and awards== * Nishan-i-Imitiaz (1998) * Hilal-i-Imtiaz (1995) * Sitara-i-Imtiaz (1989) * Gold Medal, Pakistan Academy of Sciences (1998) * Gold Medal, Institute of Leadership & Management (ILM) (1998) * Gold Medal, Society of Engineering, Materials and Metallurgical Engineering (SEMME), Karachi, (1998) * Gold Medal, Geological Society of Punjab, (1998) *Doctorate of Science Honoris Causa, UET Lahore, 2000. *Who's who in atom, American Institute of Physics (1969) ==References== ==Other websites== * Dr. Ishfaq Ahmed* Ishfaq Ahmad Minister of State * Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Pakistani physicists Category:Pakistani educators
title: Ishfaq Ahmad
